DataElement.preferredName: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Leptomeninges Disease Progression Present Classification Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of description for the disease category showing an increase in severity for the cancer that has spread from the original (primary) tumor to the tissue covering the brain, spinal cord, or both.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Leptomeninges Disease Progression Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm that has spread from its original site of growth to the leptomeninges._The worsening of a disease over time._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm to the Leptomeninges
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer that has spread from the original (primary) tumor to the tissue covering the brain, spinal cord, or both.

Concepts.longName: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Leptomeninges
Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm that has spread from its original site of growth to the leptomeninges.

Property.preferredDefinition: The worsening of a disease over time.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/16/2020: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredName: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Leptomeninges Disease Progression Classification Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The type of description for the disease category showing an increase in severity for the cancer that has spread from the original (primary) tumor to the tissue covering the brain, spinal cord, or both.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of diffuse spread of neoplastic cells to the leptomeninges that may be characterized by focal nodular enhancement on the dural, pial, or meningeal surface on MRI.

Concepts.definition: A finding of diffuse spread of neoplastic cells to the leptomeninges that may be characterized by focal nodular enhancement on the dural, pial, or meningeal surface on MRI.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of diffuse spread of neoplastic cells to the leptomeninges that may be characterized by thin, linear leptomeningeal enhancement in the central nervous system on MRI.

Concepts.definition: A finding of diffuse spread of neoplastic cells to the leptomeninges that may be characterized by thin, linear leptomeningeal enhancement in the central nervous system on MRI.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
